text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
owl cake pop tutorial where today I'm
going to show you how to make these
gorgeous little owl cake pops they're
relatively simple and they're so so cute
the things that we need for today's
tutorial I've got a couple of cakepop
balls so I've got one that's softened
ready to roll and another one that's
been refrigerated I'm going to be
showing you how to shape that today if
you don't have a great recipe for
getting your cake pops to this stage
ready to dip and decorate I will link to
our recipe in the description box below
I have a little bit of wax paper I've
got a ziploc bag quite a thick paper
straw a lollipop stick a pair of
scissors some melted milk chocolate over
here for my candy the base candy that
you're going to need really going to
need some start or flower sprinkles
you'll need some of these little white
the little candies that you get when you
pull apart one of those candy necklaces
they're basically a round white candy
with a hole in the center but you can
also use something like Wilson eyes and
you get a very similar effect I've got a
couple of these little candy coated
chocolate chips they're kind of a little
triangular shaped candy so you can also
use something like candy coated
sunflower seeds or you can just roll a
little fondant beak shape if you want to
change from a little boy out to the
little girl out you'll also need two
little pink love heart sprinkles and I
just added in one of our little
sweetheart love hearts candies I've also
got a caramel just a caramel chew or a
Jersey caramel a pretzel stick and a
couple of our pre-made wings but I'll be
showing you how to make those today so
let's get started the first thing that
we're going to do is we're going to
shape up our cake pop ball so basically
you just don't want it to be so round
you just want to rock it in the palm of
your hand just to give you sort of more
of like an overly type shape that's as
simple as it is to get our shape today
pop that one off into the fruit and you
want it to be really really nice and
firmly set so see there's some when I
push on it it doesn't push out of shape
at all you want it to be nice and firm
about 15 minutes all right you want to
take your lollipop stick now and we're
going to just dip it a little bit into
that melted white chocolate about a
centimeter or so and then just as you
insert it into the base of your cake pop
stick just twisting as you go in it just
helps it go in a little bit easier and
then you want to take your paper straw
and pop that straight up so that it's
actually sticking into the cake pop
stick and into that melted chocolate
glue to hold it all in place pop that
off into the fridge and let that one set
so you for your wings you just want to
take just a really little bit of that
melted milk chocolate you don't need
very much for each of these wings
they're only
tiny pop it into your zip lock bag
squeeze it all the way down the end and
what you want to make is to kind of like
a little teardrop shape so I just make a
big circle and then kick it out a little
bit a little point just so it's got the
point of the wing and trying to make
sure that you've got a few that actually
match up so that your doesn't matter if
they're not all the same size but so
that you put little pairs that are about
the same size something like that
we're gonna pop those ones off into the
fridge to set as well while those ones
are sitting grab just a knife or
something and we're just gonna slice off
a piece of that caramel I've just used
jersey caramels here in Australia but if
you're in America I think Kraft caramels
are very similar and you can also shape
this out of taffy or out of fondant so
I'm just going to cut that in half and
what you want is to kind of little just
pointed triangles that are slanted on
one side and a little bit flash on the
other something like that
alright so our little chocolate seals
completely set that's really nice and
firm so I'm going to take my caramels
now with the caramels I want them to be
flat side to the outside of the cake pop
and that sort of tilted side to the
inside of the cake pop so I'm going to
dip that down into that melted chocolate
which is just gonna act like a glue and
we're going to use that to glue on to
the top of our cake pop perfect give
that a couple of minutes to set you can
pop it back in the fridge very briefly
if you like okay see areas should be set
your seal should be set and your pop
should be relatively firm so now we want
to dip but you want to have your pretzel
stick your wings your eyes and your beak
at the ready and if you are going to add
on these extra details you can either
put them on after or you can add them on
at this point is depending on how
quickly your chocolates drying so to dip
your pop we're just going to pop him in
and you'll notice I've got quite a deep
container so that I don't knock his ears
off as I'm dipping just give him a nice
dip and then we're going to tap off any
excess all right now before that starts
to set to much you want to get your eyes
in first they are the most important
thing you want to be able to push those
just a little way into the chocolate
they're a bit more flush with the face
and then your little B and then your two
wings so I put the wings on so that the
flat side is actually facing out the
side that was against that wax paper it
just gives them a little bit more bounce
off the side of your owl makes them
stick out a little bit more and then you
want to take your pretzel stick which is
going to be like our little owls perch
and just push it right up into that
chocolate you will need to support that
with your thumb while you stick your
little feet on because it's not going to
dry straight away because the pretzel
sticks not cold taking your two little
stars for your feet now we're going to
stick those
right at the base kind of like their
perching on that little pretzel stick so
that gives you a basic owl if you did
want to add on like I've done over here
the little bow you'd pop in your true
little love heart sprinkles up in one
corner and rather than having the two
wings on either side you'll notice here
I actually put one kind of coming on to
holding on the love heart and the other
ones facing back in towards it so you
just put your little love heart you can
use a little bit of melted chocolate
just to a fix it straight on the front
and then pop your two little wings
grabbing on to that love heart now I
find when I add these little paper
straws on the sticks actually become
quite long so I like to just cut the
bottom couple inches off to set of the
size of a regular cake pop I hope you
guys have loved this tutorial as much as
I've enjoyed making it for you if
there's something else you'd like to see
